page.title: 16LALEHAM SCHOOL FIELD_FLORA
page.content: { {Laleham School}sits in approximately 1.5 acres of land bordered on the north by an ancient hedge about 150 years old;beyond that a field.On the east is fenced off scrubland,whilst south and west there are houses. Most of the land is grass used as a playing field,but there are some mature trees of willow,ash,oak and sycamore,and a wild area left as a nature reserve at the east. We studied the{Flora}of the grounds and found a good selection of grasses_Cocksfoot,Meadow Fescue,Tall Fescue,Couch Grass,Wild Barley,Timothy Grass,Rye Grass,Common Wild Oat,Common Reed,False Brome,Tufted Hair Grass, Quaking Grass and Wood Millet.Daisies, Speedwell,Buttercups,Clovers,Plantains ,Dandelions,Shepherds Purse,Chickweed and Wild Pansies are all quite common.
